summary: Hurricane Patricia was a super-strong storm that formed near Mexico in 2015. It became the most powerful tropical cyclone ever recorded worldwide due to its super-fast intensification. Patricia had winds up to 215 mph and a very low pressure of 872 mbar. It hit the western coast of Mexico, causing lots of damage, especially in rural areas. The storm destroyed many homes and killed at least seven people. Before becoming a hurricane, it caused flooding and affected hundreds of thousands of people in Central America. The total damage was estimated to be over $462.8 million.
title: Hurricane Patricia
